sen.j: 清岡家（きよおかけ）は江戸時代に五条為庸（正二位・大納言）（1619年 - 1677年）の次男である清岡長時（従二位・参議・式部省）（1657年 - 1718年）が起こした堂上家である。
sen.e: The Kiyooka family is a toshoke (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank) established during the Edo period by Nagatoki KIYOOKA (Junii (Junior Second Rank), Sangi (councilor), Shikibusho (Minister of Ceremonies)) (1657 - 1718), who was the second son of Tameyasu GOJO (Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Dainagon (chief councilor of state)) (1619 - 1677).

The Kiyooka family is a toshoke (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank) established during the Edo period by Nagatoki KIYOOKA (Junii - Junior Second Rank), Sangi (councilor), Shikibusho (Minister of Ceremonies) (1657 - 1718), who was the second son of Tameyasu GOJO (Shonii -Senior Second Rank) Dainagon (chief councilor of state) (1619 - 1677).

The Kiyooka family is a toshoke (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank) established during the Edo period by Nagatoki KIYOOKA (Junii - Junior Second Rank), Sangi (councilor), Shikibusho (Minister of Ceremonies) (1657 - 1718), who was the second son of Tameyasu GOJO (Shonii -Senior Second Rank) Dainagon (chief councilor of state) (1619 - 1677).

sen.j: （ちなみに正二位・中納言・式部省・桑原長義は清岡長時の兄に当たる。）
sen.e: (Incidentally, Nagayoshi KUWABARA who was Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) and Shikibusho, was Nagatoki KIYOOKA's older brother.)
(Incidentally, Nagayoshi KUWABARA who was Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) and Shikibusho, was Nagatoki KIYOOKA's older brother.)
(Incidentally, Nagayoshi KUWABARA who was Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) and Shikibusho, was Nagatoki KIYOOKA's older brother.)
The family status is hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge (court noble)).
The family status is hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge - court noble).
The family status is hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge - court noble).
Serving as historians was its family profession.
Serving as historians was the family's profession.
Serving as historians was the family's profession.

sen.j: 極官は清岡長時が得た参議・式部省である。
sen.e: The highest court positions achieved were Sangi and Shikibusho appointed to Nagatoki KIYOOKA.
The highest court positions achieved were Sangi and Shikibusho appointed to Nagatoki KIYOOKA.
The highest court positions achieved were Sangi and Shikibusho appointed to Nagatoki KIYOOKA.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 30 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was thirty koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was thirty koku.
The family was given a status as a viscount during the Meiji period.
The family was given the status as viscount during the Meiji period.
The family was given the status as viscount during the Meiji period.

sen.j: 少女ヌードの写真家として知られる清岡純子はこの家の出身である（父は大正天皇の侍従だった清岡長言）。
sen.e: Photographer of girl nudity, Junko KIYOOKA, is from this family (her father was Nagakoto KIYOOKA, who was a jiju (chamberlain) of Emperor Taisho).
sen.cmt: 清岡長言 読み方不明です。
sen.e: The photographer of female nudity, Junko KIYOOKA, is from this family (her father was Nagakoto KIYOOKA, a jiju (chamberlain of Emperor Taisho).
The photographer of female nudity, Junko KIYOOKA, is from this family (her father was Nagakoto KIYOOKA, a jiju (chamberlain of Emperor Taisho).
